definitions.definition: A long-standing group of people sharing cultural aspects such as language, dress, norms of behavior and artistic forms.
definitions.example: This society has been known for centuries for its colorful clothing and tight-knit family structure.

definitions.definition: A group of people who meet from time to time to engage in a common interest; an association or organization.
definitions.example: It was then that they decided to found a society of didgeridoo-playing unicyclists.

definitions.definition: The sum total of all voluntary interrelations between individuals.
definitions.example: The gap between Western and Eastern societies seems to be narrowing.

definitions.definition: The people of one’s country or community taken as a whole.
definitions.example: Our global society develops in fits and starts.
Smith was first introduced into society at the Duchess of Grand Fenwick's annual rose garden party.

definitions.definition: A number of people joined by mutual consent to deliberate, determine and act toward a common goal.
